segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like two different worlds—the calm outside and the mess in here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could step through that window and leave all this behind.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The plants look so well taken care of, unlike this kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost funny how the woman is so focused on drying dishes while everything else falls apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel bad for the kitchen—it doesn’t deserve this neglect.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between the garden and the kitchen is striking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman even notices the beauty outside her window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like she’s trapped in her own little world, unaware of everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish she would just turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR
